SEARCH
Package org.jarzarr

Class Window

java.lang.Object
org.jarzarr.Window
public class Window extends Object
AWT/Swing window wrapper that owns the JFrame, Canvas render surface, and a BufferStrategy.

This class is built for "active rendering": the engine requests a Graphics2D via beginFrame(), draws, then swaps via endFrame(Graphics2D).

Close behavior is library-friendly: it does not hard-exit the JVM. Instead, an setOnClose(Runnable) hook can be used to stop the engine.

  • Constructor Details

    • Window

      public Window()
      Constructs a window with default values.

    • Window

      public Window(String title)
      Constructs a window with a specific title.
      Parameters:
      title - window title

      public Window(String title, int width, int height)
      Constructs a window with a title and initial size.
      Parameters:
      title - window title
      width - preferred width
      height - preferred height

    • Window

      public Window(String title, boolean fullscreen)
      Constructs a window with a title and fullscreen preference.
      Parameters:
      title - window title
      fullscreen - if true, starts maximized

  • Method Details

    • createWindow

      public void createWindow()
      Creates the JFrame + Canvas and initializes the BufferStrategy. Call this once during engine initialization.

      Note: BufferStrategy creation must happen after the frame is visible.

    • beginFrame

      public Graphics2D beginFrame()
      Begins a frame and returns a Graphics2D for drawing.

      If the buffer strategy isn't ready or has lost contents (alt-tab/minimize), this may return null and the caller should skip rendering this frame.

      Returns:
      Graphics2D for drawing, or null if not ready this frame

    • endFrame

      public void endFrame(Graphics2D g)
      Ends a frame: disposes Graphics2D and swaps buffers.
      Parameters:
      g - Graphics2D obtained from beginFrame()

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Releases window resources. Safe to call multiple times. Disposes the JFrame which releases OS resources.

    • setOnResize

      public void setOnResize(BiConsumer<Integer,Integer> onResize)
      Sets a callback invoked when the canvas is resized.
      Parameters:
      onResize - callback receiving (width, height)

    • setOnClose

      public void setOnClose(Runnable onClose)
      Sets a callback invoked when the user requests window close. Typical use is engine::stop.
      Parameters:
      onClose - close callback

    • isFullscreen

      public boolean isFullscreen()
      Returns:
      true if the window starts maximized.

    • setFullscreen

      public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
      Sets whether the window starts maximized (windowed fullscreen).
      Parameters:
      fullscreen - true to start maximized

    • isResizable

      public boolean isResizable()
      Returns:
      true if user can resize the window.

    • setResizable

      public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
      Sets whether the window is resizable. Must be called before createWindow() to affect the JFrame.
      Parameters:
      resizable - true if resizable

    • getBufferCount

      public int getBufferCount()
      Returns:
      number of buffers in the strategy.

    • setBufferCount

      public void setBufferCount(int bufferCount)
      Sets buffer count for the BufferStrategy. Values invalid input: '<' 2 are clamped to 2. Must be set before createWindow() to apply cleanly.
      Parameters:
      bufferCount - requested buffer count

    • getClearColor

      public Color getClearColor()
      Returns:
      clear color used each frame.

    • setClearColor

      public void setClearColor(Color clearColor)
      Sets the clear color used in beginFrame().
      Parameters:
      clearColor - background color

    • getCanvas

      public Canvas getCanvas()
      Returns:
      canvas render surface (also used for input listeners).

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Returns:
      underlying JFrame.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns:
      current title.

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String title)
      Sets window title. If the frame already exists, updates it live.
      Parameters:
      title - new title

    • getSize

      public Dimension getSize()
      Returns:
      preferred initial size.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets preferred canvas size. If already created, updates preferred size and repacks.
      Parameters:
      width - preferred width
      height - preferred height

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns current canvas width if available, otherwise preferred width.
      Returns:
      width in pixels

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns current canvas height if available, otherwise preferred height.
      Returns:
      height in pixels
